metadata.title: FedRAMP Security Assessment Plan (SAP)

roles.title: FedRAMP Program Management Office
roles.description: The organization that prepared this SSP. If developed in-house, this is the CSP itself.

roles.title: Prepared By
roles.description: The organization that prepared this SAP.

roles.title: Prepared For
roles.description: The organization for which this SAP was prepared. Typically the CSP.

roles.title: Security Assessment Plan Approval
roles.description: The individual or individuals accountable for the accuracy of this SAP.

roles.title: Assessment Organization
roles.description: The organization performing the assessment.

roles.title: Assessment Team
roles.description: The individual or individuals performing the assessment.

roles.title: Assessment Lead
roles.description: The individual leading the assessment activities.

roles.title: Penetration Test Team
roles.description: The individual or individuals performing the penetration test.

roles.title: Penetration Test Lead
roles.description: The individual leading the penetration test activities.

roles.title: Assessment Organization's Managerial POC
roles.description: The management-level POC within the assessor's organization accountable for the organization's assessment performance.

roles.title: CSP POCs During Testing
roles.description: At least three CSP testing points of contact must be identified in a FedRAMP SAP.

roles.title: CSP's End of Testing Notification POC
roles.description: A role for an individual within the CSP to be notified by the assessor when testing is complete.

roles.title: CSP Results POCs
roles.description: A role for the individuals within the CSP who are to receive the assessment results.

roles.title: FedRAMP Program Management Office
roles.description: Members of the JAB include the chief information officers (CIOs) from the Department of Defense, Department of Homeland Security, and General Services Administration. The JAB serves as the primary governance and decision-making body for FedRAMP.

roles.title: Cloud Service Provider (CSP) Name
roles.description: Cloud Service Provider used by the client

roles.title: Information System Owner
roles.description: The individual within the CSP who is ultimately accountable for everything related to this system.

roles.title: asset owner
roles.description: asset owner

roles.title: asset administrator
roles.description: administrator

roles.title: Authorizing Official
roles.description: The individual or individuals who must grant this system an authorization to operate.

roles.title: Authorizing Official's Point of Contact
roles.description: The individual representing the authorizing official.

roles.title: Information System Management Point of Contact (POC)
roles.description: The highest level manager who responsible for system operation on behalf of the System Owner.

roles.title: Information System Technical Point of Contact
roles.description: The individual or individuals leading the technical operation of the system.

roles.title: System Information System Security Officer (or Equivalent)
roles.description: The individual accountable for the security posture of the system on behalf of the system owner.

roles.title: Privacy Official's Point of Contact
roles.description: The individual responsible for the privacy threshold analysis and if necessary the privacy impact assessment.

roles.title: General Point of Contact (POC)
roles.description: A general point of contact for the system, designated by the system owner.

locations.title: Shellman & Company, Inc. HQ
locations.remarks: The assessor's HQ, or the address of the assessment team's primary business location.

parties.name: Shellman & Company, Inc.
parties.remarks: Replace sample 3PAO information. If the assessor is A2LA Certified, include the ISO/IEC-17020

parties.name: Federal Risk and Authorization Management Program: Program Management Office
parties.remarks: This party entry must be present in a FedRAMP SAP. The uuid may be different; however, the uuid must be associated with the \"fedramp-pmo\" role in the responsible-party assemblies.

responsible-parties.remarks: Exactly one party This is the assessor.

One or more parties If the \"responsible-party\" contains multiple \"party-uuid\", FedRAMP assumes the \"ia-validated\" and \"csp-validated\" prop values apply to each referenced party. Alternatively, assessment team member can be specified in separate \"responsible-party\" data items, each with their own \"ia-validated\" and \"csp-validated\" prop.

There should be at least three CSP Assessment POCs. At least one should be available 24x7 during assessment activities. At least one should be an operations center, such a SOC or NOC. The party-uuid should observation-source a party in the SSP or SAP. If an appropriate party does not exist in the SSP or SAP, the SAR tool should add a party to the SAR. The SAP tool should not modify the SSP.

metadata.remarks: This OSCAL-based FedRAMP SAP Template can be used for the FedRAMP initial or annual assessment planning.

props.name: authentication-method
props.remarks: The Fortify Authorization service implements several authentication methods to ensure secure access to the ACME Pro Application. The primary methods used are:1. **Password-Based Authentication**: Each user is assigned a unique username and password, which is required for initial login. Passwords must meet complexity requirements, including a mix of uppercase letters, lowercase letters, digits, and special characters.2. **Multi-Factor Authentication (MFA)**: MFA is mandatory for all users accessing the ACME Pro Application, especially for privileged accounts. This method requires users to provide an additional verification factor, such as a security key or a mobile authenticator app, after entering their password. This enhances security by ensuring that access is granted only when multiple forms of identification are verified.3. **Single Sign-On (SSO)**: The system supports SSO through Azure Entra, allowing users to authenticate once and gain access to multiple applications without needing to log in separately for each one. This is particularly useful for government agencies that may require integration with their existing identity management systems.4. **Session Management**: Users are required to re-authenticate after periods of inactivity (e.g., 15 minutes), and sessions will terminate if there is no response within five minutes of a prompt. This helps

Passwords must contain characters from at least three categories, including uppercase letters, lowercase letters, numbers, and special characters.3. **Single Sign-On (SSO)**: The system integrates with Azure Entra for SSO, allowing users to authenticate once and gain access to multiple applications without needing to log in again. This is particularly useful for government agencies that require compliance with specific authentication standards.4. **Session Management**: Users are automatically logged out after 30 minutes of inactivity, requiring re-authentication to resume access. Additionally, after 15 minutes of inactivity, a prompt appears asking users if they are still present, and failure to respond

components.title: Azure System
components.description: Azure System is a Leveraged Auth System for package: Azure Commercial Cloud

props.name: authentication-method
props.remarks: In Microsoft Azure Commercial Cloud, authentication is primarily managed through Azure Active Directory (AAD), which supports various methods to ensure secure access to resources.1. **Password-based Authentication**: Users authenticate by entering their username and password. Azure enforces strong password policies to enhance security.2. **Multi-Factor Authentication (MFA)**: Azure supports MFA, requiring users to provide additional verification (such as a code sent to their mobile device) alongside their password. This adds an extra layer of security to the authentication process.3. **Single Sign-On (SSO)**: Azure enables SSO, allowing users to access multiple applications with one set of credentials. This is facilitated through AAD, which manages user sessions and tokens across integrated applications.4. **Conditional Access Policies**: Azure implements conditional access, which evaluates user context (such as location, device state, and risk level) before granting access. This ensures that authentication requirements can adapt based on the user's situation.These authentication methods are integrated into the Azure platform, providing a robust framework for managing user identities and securing access to cloud resources.

control-selections.description: Control Scope Initial assessments include all controls. Annual assessment include a subset of controls as defined by FedRAMP Continuous Monitoring Guidance and any adjudicating officials. This example demonstrates including all controls identified in the SSP's baseline, and then explicilty excludes AC-1.

control-objective-selections.description: Control Objective Scope Within the OSCAL-based FedRAMP baselines, FedRAMP has defined the control objectives for which an assessor must respond. Those must be explicityly listed here. This template only includes the AC-2(f) response points from the FedRAMP Moderate Baseline based on NIST SP 800-53 Revision 4. This is analgous to the individual rows listed in the empty FedRAMP Test Case Workbook ([Moderate](https://www.fedramp.gov/assets/resources/templates/SAP-AA-FedRAMP-Moderate-Security-Test-Case-Procedures-Template.xlsx)). Note that the specified objective-ids must exist in the referenced profile / catalog.

reviewed-controls.remarks: # IMPORTANT: RESPONSE POINTS Within each FedRAMP baseline, FedRAMP has added \"response-point\" properties as a FedRAMP Extension. These are found in control statements (for CSPs to use in their SSP) and in control objectives (for assessors to use in their SAP and SAR). SAP tools should scan the appropriate baseline (as identified by the SSP's `import-profile` statement), find the response points associated with control objectives (ignoring response points associated with statements), and insert one `include-objective` field for each identified response point. For this task, tools should either scan the resolved profile catalog version of each baseline, or resolve the profile against its catalog before processing. XPath for all control objectie response points in a resolved profile catalog: `//control/part[@name='objective']//prop[@name='response-point'][@ns='https://fedramp.gov/ns/oscal']/../@id`  XPath for AC-2(f) control objective response points in a resolved profile catalog: `//\*/part[@name='objective' and contains(@id, 'ac-2.f')]/prop[@name='response-point'][@ns='https://fedramp.gov/ns/oscal']/../@id`

resources.title: Signatures
resources.description: The following individuals at [IA Name] and [CSP Name] have been identified as having the authority to agree to security testing of [CSO Name]. [CSP Name] has validated that the [IA Name] assessors assigned to this project fulfill the FedRAMP assessor requirements, as noted in Section 6.1 and formally named in Table 6-1. This section must be signed and dated prior to an IA beginning an assessment.
resources.remarks: FedRAMP is formulating guidelines for handling digital/electronic signatures in OSCAL, and welcome feedback on solutions. For now, FedRAMP recommends one of the following: * Render the OSCAL SAP signature page as a PDF that is digitally signed and attached. * Render the OSCAL SAP signature page as a printed page that is physically signed, scanned, and attached.  If your organization prefers another approach, please seek prior approval from the FedRAMP PMO.

resources.title: Sampling Methodology
resources.description: Embed or reference copies of the sampling methodology for security controls assessment and vulnerability scanning (if applicable).

resources.title: Penetration Testing Plan and Methodology
resources.description: The following table captures the minimum requirements for penetration testing based on FedRAMP requirements. Additional attack vectors are outlined in the table below and will be recorded in the [CSO Name] Penetration Test Report. Deviations between this list and the Penetration Test Report will be recorded and explained in the SAR table “Deviations from the SAP”. Techniques to test each system may vary depending on the service offering (IaaS, PaaS, SaaS, and Hybrid). Due to system commonalities, the mandatory attack vectors apply to all systems, as indicated by the “x” in the “Include” column. Ensure that all the appropriate threat models and attack models are marked a “x”, as well. The [CSO Name] Penetration Test Report will include the testing of all the parameters, as indicated in this table. | Include | Mandatory Attack Vectors | Include | Threat Models | Include | Attack Models | | --- | --- | --- | --- | --- | --- | | x | External to Corporate |  | Internet based (untrusted) |  | Enterprise | | x | External to CSP Target System |  | Network Threat Actor |  | Reconnaissance | | x | Tenant to CSP Management System |  | Attack on CSP managed user |  | Resource Development | | x | Tenant to Tenant |  | Email attack against CSP managed user |  | Initial Access | | x | Mobile Application to Target System |  | Application Threat Actor |  | Execution | | x | Client-side Application and/or Agents to Target System |  | Physical based attack |  | Persistence |

resources.title: Significant Change Request Documentation
resources.description: The following is SCR documentation that was submitted by [CSP Name] to [Choose One: AO/JAB] * the SCR Form(s) and Supporting Documents * the SCR Inventory (e.g., any components that are being added to the inventory, removed from the inventory, or are being modified or directly impacted by the change(s). * the Embedded Excel File using the FedRAMP Standard Inventory Template  Roles are described in the [CSO Name] SSP, Section 11, Separation of Duties. Additional roles that are being introduced as part of significant changes will be tested and are noted in Table D-1. Role testing will be performed to test the authorization restrictions for each role. [IA Name] will access the system while logged in as different user types and attempt to perform restricted functions for that user. | Role Name | Test User ID | Associated Functions | | --- | --- | --- | |  |  |  |
